news.content: By Engagement Lab (Roma Dash) 08/26/2015 Hand washing with soap and water (HWWS) has been shown to significantly reduce the rate of diarrhea and pneumonia in children. It is, however, a practice that is carried out in less than 1 in 8 Ghanaian households.
news.title: Hand Washing With Ananse
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Engagement Lab 08/13/2015 Often times the notion of human development gets lost in a swirling vortex of tedious administrative processes that people have to wade through. Although humans are invested in changing and improving their communities, the methods used to reel them in lack a certain element.
news.title: Games for Development [VIDEO]
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Becky Michelson 09/17/2015 Announcing @Stake 2.0! We've listened to your feedback and have updated @Stake- the tabletop card game for deliberative democracy. You can now download a printable guide with new rules and role cards here: http://engagementgamelab.org/games/@stake/ Start playing today! We want to know who plays the game and what feedback you have!
news.title: Announcing: A Printable @Stake Game
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Engagement Lab (Roma Dash) 08/05/2015 When people open their browsers, be it on their laptops or the desktops, the first thing they see is either a blank screen for a new tab or their customized version of "welcome to a new day, here's some financial headlines you selected to view once but surely aren't interested in anymore, so let's start working."
news.title: NewsPix: Local News That You Can Use
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: The best intentions of local government to enact policy and programs that positively impact low income people are often compromised by a lack of communication, effective listening, and relationship building. How local government meaningfully engages its constituents, especially more vulnerable and hard to reach populations, is (or should be) a central concern of every department - from the mayor's office, to public works and planning.
news.title: Improving Public Engagement: 5 Cities Get to Work
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Becky Michelson 06/30/2015 "Democracy is a verb" is the tagline of the Mikva Challenge: an organization that focuses on civic education and empowerment for youth, based in Chicago. Last week, they hosted the "New Civics Practitioners Conference": the first conference of it's kind bringing together ~200 civic education leaders, youth program workers, and educators nationwide.
news.title: Digital Activism Panel Reflections from the New Civics Practitioners Conference
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Engagement Lab 06/29/2015 We've got big news to share: after more than three years as Managing Director, Stephen Walter will be transitioning from his role at the Engagement Lab to focus full time on building ships inside bottles and sled-dog racing.
news.title: Mariko Davidson Named Managing Director of Engagement Lab
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Engagement Lab 06/11/2015 Moderator: Susan Owusu, Director of Wheelock College's Communications and Media Literacy program Panelists: Jabari Asim, Associate Professor of Writing, Literature, and Publishing at Emerson College, Editor-in-Chief of The Crisis magazine, the oldest publication in the United States pertaining to African-American issues.
news.title: Liveblog of Research in the Mo(ve)ment: Civic Media, Political Unrest, and the Role of the...
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: By Engagement Lab (Guest Writer: Dhafer Hasan) 09/23/2015 Last week I was in Cairo learning about games Over nearly a decade working with young people in Iraq, I have been skeptical about taking serious steps to develop a game for social purposes.
news.title: Games for Social Change Building Capacity in Iraq
news.author: Engagement Lab

news.content: Paul contextualizes the panelists remarks for the Q+A portion of the session. Demands from universities to think about civic engagement as more than service learning, making students work more part of the lived world while making sure they are getting meaningful learning out of it.
news.title: Boston Civic Media: Metrics & Methods conference | Session 3: Institutions
news.author: Engagement Lab

name.text: Boston Civic Media Mini-Conference: Academic-Community Collaboration
name.html: Boston Civic Media Mini-Conference: Academic-Community Collaboration

description.text:
You are Invited! 
Please join the growing Boston Civic Media network on Jan 29th, 2016, for a convening of university faculty, community organizations and students. 
The mission of the Boston Civic Media Network is to build academic-community relationships, share knowledge and develop innovative curriculum in civic media*. 
At our January gathering our theme is Academic-Community Collaboration. We will discuss academic-community lessons, best/worst practices, and future directions for collaboration. Participants will have a chance to learn about previous and existing collaborations between academic researchers, individual classes and community institutions, understand pitfalls and challenges of collaborations, and brainstorm new approaches to sustainable and mutually beneficial practices. The event will be facilitated by Willow Brugh. 
Agenda 
2-2:15   Welcome to Boston Civic Media 
2:15-2:45  Lightning Talks: Civic Failures and Community Partner Presentations 
2:45-4:15   Partnered Pedagogy in Practice: Case Studies and Breakout Discussions 
4:15-5   Civic Speed-dating and Issue Focused Brainstorms 
After the event is over, there will be happy hour and mingling at a nearby establishment (details forthcoming). 
  
Please RSVP soon as spots will fill up fast! 
  
We look forward to your participation, 
The Organizing Team 
Becky Michelson, BCM Coordinator, Emerson Engagement Lab 
Catherine D'Ignazio, Assistant Professor, Emerson College 
Eric Gordon, Associate Professor, Emerson College 
Paul Mihailidis, Associate Professor, Emerson College 

  
*What is Civic Media? 
Civic media are the mediated practices of designing, building, implementing or using digital tools to intervene in or participate in civic life. The emerging domain of civic media includes researchers and practitioners from many fields and sectors including art, design, computer science, social sciences, humanities, government, urban planning, community organizing, law & policy, education and more.
